original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day on Monday as the market sees higher selling pressures, an analyst said.
“The market is seeing more selling pressures as as investors are taking a stance until more clarity is given on domestic debt restructuring assurances and interest rates are high,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was down by 1.33 percent or 115.96 points to 8,601.00, while the most liquid index was down 1.28 percent or 31.80 points to 2,446.60.
Top losers during mid day trade were Vallibel One, Commercial Bank and LOLC. (Colombo/May22/2023
